languages.title: JavaScript
languages.description: A high-level, dynamic language primarily used for web development on both client and server sides, supporting event-driven, functional, and object-oriented programming.

languages.title: TypeScript
languages.description: A statically typed superset of JavaScript that adds type safety and tooling improvements, commonly used for large-scale web applications, supporting OOP, functional, and event-driven programming.

languages.title: Python
languages.description: A versatile, high-level language known for readability and ease of use, widely used in web development, data science, automation, and AI, supporting procedural, OOP, and functional programming.

languages.title: Haskell
languages.description: A pure functional programming language with strong static typing and lazy evaluation, ideal for academic research, compilers, and high-assurance software.

languages.title: Java
languages.description: A class-based, object-oriented language with platform independence, widely used for enterprise applications, Android apps, and large-scale systems.

languages.title: C++
languages.description: A powerful, multi-paradigm language supporting procedural, object-oriented, and generic programming, commonly used for system software, games, and performance-critical applications.

languages.title: C#
languages.description: A modern, object-oriented language developed by Microsoft for Windows applications, web development, and game development, also supporting functional programming patterns.

languages.title: Ruby
languages.description: A dynamic, high-level language known for simplicity and productivity, commonly used in web development (e.g., Rails), supporting object-oriented and functional programming.

languages.title: Swift
languages.description: A modern language for iOS and macOS development, supporting safety, performance, object-oriented, and functional programming.

languages.title: Go
languages.description: A statically typed language designed at Google for simplicity, concurrency, and efficiency, commonly used for web services and cloud applications, supporting procedural and imperative paradigms.

languages.title: Rust
languages.description: A systems programming language focused on safety, concurrency, and performance, supporting functional, object-oriented, and imperative programming patterns.

languages.title: C
languages.description: A procedural, low-level language widely used for systems programming, embedded systems, and performance-critical applications.

languages.title: SQL
languages.description: A domain-specific language used for managing and querying relational databases, supporting declarative programming and procedural extensions.

languages.title: Kotlin
languages.description: A modern, statically typed language for Android and JVM applications, supporting object-oriented and functional programming.

languages.title: R
languages.description: A language and environment for statistical computing and graphics, widely used in data analysis and scientific research.

languages.title: Bash
languages.description: A Unix shell and command language used for scripting, automation, and system administration tasks, supporting procedural and imperative programming.

languages.title: PowerShell
languages.description: A command-line interface and scripting language for Windows, supporting declarative and imperative programming.
